p: We predicted that facilitation by cushion plants will be stronger and more important in maintaining species diversity in disturbed areas, an effect amplified at higher elevations (Hypothesis 3). However, we did not find an amplified facilitative effect on inside species by Silene cushions in disturbed areas, or support for any other interaction between cushion presence and disturbance (Table 2). In contrast to findings of some previous studies, cushion presence has a significant negative effect on species richness (Figure 5a,c), and a moderate negative effect on both Shannon diversity (Figure 5b,d) and percent vegetation cover (Supporting Information Figure A3a,c in Appendix S1).
